data.text: @SarahMarshallJP Caught it 2 days before my wife caught it. I was still testing positive on day 12 my wife was negative on day 8, 😕😕😕😕

Finally tested negative this morning, which is a bit of a relief because I've been going stir crazy. Can't wait to leave the house for the first time in two weeks! I stayed home for a few days before I tested positive because my partner had it & I was worried about passing it on.
@SarahMarshallJP I avoided leaving the house as much as possible until I got a negative result, but always wore a mask when I had to

@jmbcarreiras Ooft, that's a long time to be testing positive! My self-isolation period technically ends tomorrow at midnight, but I'm not sure I'd feel comfortable with leaving the house if I'm still testing positive by then.
@SarahMarshallJP I only started testing negative on day 13
@SarahMarshallJP 12 days - but it depends how long you'd already had it before you tested and found you were positive (as well as being different for different people anyway)
@SarahMarshallJP It does vary, wife 6 days daughter 8
@SarahMarshallJP This last time I stopped testing +ve on day 5, so fair to say it varies a lot.
